item.title: What to know about the international flotilla that sought to break Israel's blockade of Gaza
item.description: The activists expected Israeli authorities to intercept them, as has happened in past flotilla attempts to reach Gaza.

item.title: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk becomes world's first person to be valued over $500 billion
item.description: The Tesla and SpaceX CEO's net worth hit $US500 billion ($755 billion) on Wednesday, the "Real-Time Billionaires" tracker reported.

item.title: Man charged with lighting fires after start of fire bans in Queensland
item.description: A 27-year-old man has been charged with deliberately setting fire to bushland in Blackswamp, south-west Queensland, during a total fire ban.

item.title: South West Aboriginal Medical Service members expelled after allegedly 'storming' headquarters
item.description: The South West Aboriginal Medical Service has expelled several of its members who it has accused of sowing community division.

item.title: Wallabies bolstered by Will Skelton's return for Bledisloe Cup Test against All Blacks in Perth
item.description: The Wallabies regain enforcer Will Skelton for Saturday night's sold-out Bledisloe Cup Test in Perth, but veteran fly half James O'Connor is dropped to the bench.

item.title: Review finds Barkly bushfire overwhelmed authorities and killed 37,000 cattle
item.description: The fire threatened communities, destroyed more than 3,500km of fencing and cost the NT's cattle industry an estimated $120 million.

item.title: Fertility treatments impacted by donor limit mix-up can proceed under NSW Health exemption
item.description: Fertility treatments in NSW will be able to continue even in cases where the family donor limit has been breached after the state government issued a temporary exemption.

item.title: Colonnades, Modbury, Tea Tree and Rundle Mall among latest shopping centres to become Declared Public Precincts
item.description: Three Adelaide shopping centres are among the latest sites where police can search for knives.

item.title: Coutts Crossing bushfire downgraded from emergency to advice
item.description: A day into the bushfire season, a blaze threatening more than a dozen buildings in the Clarence Valley has been downgraded after escalating to an emergency level.

item.title: Canberra cyclist captures 'incredible' moment magpie plucks earphone from his ear on camera
item.description: A Canberra man has captured footage of the dramatic moment a magpie plucked his earphone from his ear.

item.title: Demons meet with Clayton Oliver amid rumoured exit from AFL club
item.description: Clayton Oliver appears set to leave Melbourne after the Demons reveal they will not stand in his way if he wants to consider a trade to another club.

item.title: Broncos respond to Storm star Stefano Utoikamanu's 'stuck up' barb ahead of NRL grand final
item.description: The mind games continue in the build-up to Sunday's season decider, with the Broncos reacting to Storm front-rower Stefano Utoikamanu's sledge earlier this week.

item.title: Endangered numbats stressed by over-eager nature photographers, authorities say
item.description: Authorities say getting to close to numbats can make them anxious enough to abandon their young and are urging photographers to give the endangered animals their space.

item.title: Mildura leaders label Qantas staff base closure a 'slap in the face' to region
item.description: Regional politicians unanimously condemn Qantas over the impending closure of its Mildura crew base, saying it underscores the city's vulnerability to the "whims" of private transport companies.

item.title: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy accuses Russia of raising nuclear risk after Chernobyl power cut
item.description: Volodymyr Zelenskyy said more than 20 Russian drones had been deployed in the attack on the town of Slavutych that cut power to the nearby Chernobyl plant for three hours.

item.title: Thursday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Review into senior NT police appointments made under ousted commissioner released to the public
item.description: An inquiry into recruitment processes for senior NT police positions recommends "significant improvements", noting there are "widely held beliefs" that "bias", "favouritism" and "nepotism" have impacted promotions within the force.

item.title: BBC exposes hidden culture of misogyny and racism inside UK Police
item.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer has called for a "robust" response by the head of London's Metropolitan Police after an undercover investigation exposed the force's hidden culture of misogyny and racism.

item.title: Protesters restrained at snap pro-Palestinian rally at Sydney Town Hall
item.description: The unauthorised event was held in response to the interception of a Gaza-bound aid flotilla.

item.title: Japan's top contenders for prime minister are an 'Iron Lady' and the son of a former PM
item.description: Japan's Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba is stepping down as leader after only a year in the role. It has left his party looking for a new face — and the frontrunner options could not be more different.

item.title: Sexual predator taught in Brisbane schools for nine years after parents' complaints
item.description: Even after putting a stop to their abuser's access to students, Alliyah faced an uphill battle to get basic information about what had happened behind the scenes.

item.description: The global COP climate talks have been a source of frustration and disappointment for Pacific nations. They hope hosting the event will change that.

item.description: Businesses hurt by stay-away orders issued during the search for alleged police killer Dezi Freeman say they have yet to receive the government support they were promised.

item.description: The Hollywood director has been present in the film space for many years but the emergence of AI and its power has him somewhat scared for the future.

item.title: Jane Goodall changed how we thought about chimps. Why did we know so little before?

item.title: Bendigo nurses call for hospital mental health hub as ED presentations climb
item.description: An increase in mental health and drug-related emergencies puts strain on Bendigo hospital's emergency department, prompting calls for a dedicated treatment hub.

item.title: NSW Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon says he wants to get force's culture 'right'
item.description: The new commissioner of NSW Police does not believe there is still a "boys' club" within the force, but says behaviour that prompted a workplace culture review will not be accepted under his leadership.

item.description: The search for missing four-year-old Gus has entered its seventh day, with no new signs of the boy.

item.description: Hawthorn posts a third consecutive AFLW victory to boost its top-four hopes, outlasting Fremantle in cold and windy conditions in Frankston.

item.description: Craig Bellamy and Michael Maguire know each other better than most NRL coaches, and that familiarity will play a major part in how they tackle the NRL grand final.

item.title: Outback residents lose solar farm as Ergon battles push owner to close
item.description: The owner of a huge solar farm in outback Queensland hits the kill switch after almost a decade, saying his contract with Ergon Energy was unfair.

item.description: From gargantuan cows to Canola fields visible from space, here are our top photos from WA's first month of spring.

item.description: The gold-mining sector is set to boost WA's economy, with 2,400 new jobs forecast over the next five years compared to 1,200 in iron ore.

item.description: The Russian president says it is NATO that is the "paper tiger," and "if anyone still has a desire to compete with us in the military sphere, as we say, feel free, let them try".

item.description: The ASX has made modest gains after trading flat early on, as a slide for energy producers offset gains for industrial, healthcare and tech stocks.

item.title: Zach Merrett's Essendon future in Bombers' hands despite star's apparent best and fairest farewell

item.description: Queensland firefighters tackling scores of incidents, including a bushfire about 20 kilometres north of Brisbane now downgraded after police made an emergency declaration.

item.description: There's been a spike in reports of violent and anti-social incidents in the CBD, as Darwin businesses call for more government investment in late-night security patrols.

item.description: As recovery efforts continue, some parents have argued with emergency services, demanding they speed up their work so they can bury their loved ones.

item.description: Research by Federation University has found 63 per cent of girls have missed training, and a third have missed competitions, because of period-related challenges in athletics and swimming.

item.title: Russian strike hits Ukrainian passenger train at Shostka station, authorities say
item.description: A Russian drone strike has hit a passenger train in Ukraine's northern Sumy region and injured dozens of people in an act President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has denounced as 'terrorism'.

item.title: Diamonds defeat Proteas 64-53 in first netball Test in Bendigo
item.description: Australia has overcome a promising start from South Africa to win 64-53 in the first netball Test in Bendigo.

item.title: Mitch Marsh inspires Australia to three-wicket win over New Zealand in third T20I
item.description: Mitch Marsh's first T20I century helped the Australian men's team record a stunning three-wicket win over New Zealand across the Tasman.

item.title: Newcastle Jets defeat semi-professional Heidelberg United 3-1 to lift first Australia Cup
item.description: The Newcastle Jets have defeated semi-professional club Heidelberg United 3-1 to claim their first silverware since 2008.

item.title: Betting companies keep millions stolen from investors by 'VIP' gambler
item.description: Nick and Aimee Mazza's hard-earned cash was gambled away by a man they thought was investing it. Bookmakers encouraged him to keep betting.

item.title: What time does the NRL grand final kick off? When is the NRLW grand final?
item.description: Kick-off times, pre-game entertainment and all the players taking the field. Here's everything you need to know for grand final day in Sydney.

item.title: Fried shark and maggots: Indonesia's free meal program poisons thousands of children
item.description: The key election commitment of President Prabowo Subianto is facing mounting backlash over its poor oversight, questionable food sourcing and unhygienic kitchens.

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs has been sentenced to four years in prison. Here's a breakdown of the case and where to next
item.description: Sean "Diddy" Combs may have just been sentenced to four years in prison, but he still faces a mountain of lawsuits accusing him of sexual violence and other misconduct.

item.title: AI is creeping into our court system. Will it undermine justice?
item.description: Artificial intelligence is coming for the law. Are we ready for robots to become judge and jury?

item.title: Israel, Hamas and US to begin new Gaza peace talks, as Netanyahu says he wants negotiations done quickly
item.description: Representatives of Israel, Hamas and the United States are set to begin fresh talks in Egypt about how to implement Donald Trump's Gaza ceasefire plan.

item.title: Hard Quiz Kids: Tom Gleeson is back grilling baby-faced brainiacs. Are you smarter than them?
item.description: I find it interesting you think you could beat the know-it-all tweens on Hard Quiz Kids. How about you prove it? Let's play, HARD!

item.title: Palestinian photojournalist Ali Jadallah wins Siena Awards Photo Festival
item.description: Ali Jadallah's photo, called Leaving Home, shows three people emerging from the rubble of their damaged building.

item.title: Will Labor's housing fund recover from its rocky start and fix decades of decline?
item.description: It takes a long time to build anything at all in Australia's dysfunctional housing market, even for the federal government, but Labor's social housing fund is inching towards an impact.

item.title: Donald Trump's Gaza ceasefire plan could become the single best hope to end the bloodshed
item.description: For the first time since the conflict in Gaza began nearly two years ago, an American president told Israel to stop — and it did.

item.title: Rowdy wartime behaviour revealed as Sydney's Luna Park celebrates 90th birthday
item.description: Now in its 90th year, Sydney's Luna Park was not always so family-friendly.

item.title: Victoria's record crime wave sees the premier and police chief steering different ships
item.description: While Premier Jacinta Allan narrows in on machetes and bail laws, Chief Commissioner Mike Bush is looking to broader horizons as Victoria witnesses record levels of offending.

item.title: Smaller homes in demand during regional housing crunch
item.description: Councillors say they recognise that small housing is needed to meet housing demand, but state government support will be needed to build key infrastructure.

item.title: The changes hidden within 'cryptic' supermarket ingredient labels
item.description: The main ingredient in dozens of supermarket products has been reduced, an ABC investigation has found, leading retail and marketing experts to call for more transparency around recipe changes.

item.title: Oscar Piastri satisfied with advantage over McLaren teammate Lando Norris in Singapore GP qualifying
item.description: Oscar Piastri pronounces himself satisfied after finishing third in qualifying to gain an advantage over fifth-placed teammate Lando Norris at the Singapore GP.

item.title: Populist billionaire Andrej Babiš wins Czech Republic parliamentary election
item.description: The party of billionaire and self-declared "Trumpist" Andrej Babiš wins the Czech Republic's parliamentary election, near-final results show, which could steer the country away from supporting Ukraine.

item.title: Sport is where the heart is, as the Irish diaspora descends on Willawong for the Australasian Gaelic Championships
item.description: As over 400 players head to Brisbane for the Australasia Gaelic Games Championships, the bond that exists between a distant home and sport is laid bare.

item.title: How the Tallis Scholars opened the world of sacred choral music to new audiences
item.description: This English vocal group took centuries-old church music from the archives and became a hit. They're back in Australia sharing this music with local audiences.

item.title: Economics rather than environmental concerns could sink Woodside's proposed Browse gas project
item.description: The Browse gas project is staring down the full weight of Australia's climate movement. Analysts say that is the least of its worries.

item.title: Australia was champion of the world three years ago, but now softball teams are struggling to find players
item.description: It was a schoolyard sport so common it once rivalled cricket as the most popular in Australia. But now grassroots teams are struggling to fill a team sheet.

item.title: Some South Australian farmers facing long road to drought recovery
item.description: Some South Australian farmers say they are still feeling the strain of drought after inconsistent winter rains left little room for recovery before the coming summer.

item.title: Alex De Minaur hits career-best mark with win at Shanghai Masters as ATP Finals loom
item.description: Alex de Minaur sets a new personal record for wins in a year with a comfortable victory over Camilo Ugo Carabelli at the Shanghai Masters.

item.title: From 'snotty nose' to 'giggling goose', how language used by MPs is deemed to be unparliamentary
item.description: In Australian politics, words and phrases used in parliament that are seen as insulting, abusive, or a deliberate lie are determined to be "unparliamentary language".

item.title: Amadeo Ambrosino uses a robot at school to learn
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Prospecting mates who found Ming Dynasty Buddha urge prime minister to help repatriate it to China
item.description: A Ming Dynasty Buddha statue found on a roadside in Western Australia's Shark Bay region seven years ago could soon be repatriated to the largest Buddhist population in the world.

item.title: Jahrome Hughes says he 'used to hate' the Storm as he prepares for grand final battle
item.description: Jahrome Hughes admits to once being sick of watching Melbourne win, but now the Kiwi can help lead them to another premiership in the NRL grand final.

item.title: Line dancing helps Queensland community connect and keep moving
item.description: Organisers behind line dancing events say more people are coming to their evenings, and social media is driving its popularity.

item.title: Health workers say NT leading the nation in hepatitis B care, as diagnoses jump but mortality rates plummet
item.description: Health workers say new data showing hepatitis B cases have almost tripled in the NT reflects better access to care, with the territory also leading the nation in reducing mortality rates.

item.title: Babe's 30th anniversary celebrated in Robertson where film was shot
item.description: Decades after hosting film crews making a children's movie about a loveable piglet, the town of Robertson in New South Wales is transformed into a country fair in tribute.

item.title: Greens leader says she is unsure about Robbins Island wind farm
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Greens leader Larissa Waters 'doesn't know very much' about wind farm opposed by colleagues
item.description: Larissa Waters says she will be looking closely at the Robbins Island wind farm, which the Greens's two Tasmanian senators say will threaten several endangered species.

item.title: Community saves endangered tropical sea turtle that washed up on Esperance beach
item.description: A community has sprung into action to nurse a juvenile tropical turtle back to health as wildlife carers question how it found its way to WA's south coast.

item.title: Harry Lush director of Gondwana Project
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: English springer spaniels Kelly and Milo helping fight dieback in Western Australia
item.description: Two dogs join the fight against one of the biggest threats to Australia's native plants, making dieback detection possible in minutes rather than weeks.

item.title: I got an unexpected afternoon tea invitation, and it told me a lot about Donald Trump
item.description: An afternoon tea meeting with a president is not the sort of invitation you get every day as a foreign correspondent, but when I met Finland's Alexander Stubb in Helsinki, it taught me a lot about another world leader.

item.title: Inside the 'Trinity of Chaos' group of young hackers targeting major companies
item.description: Cybersecurity analysts warn that three of the most notorious English-speaking cybercrime groups are still operating as the "super group" known as Trinity of Chaos, despite recently announcing retirement.

item.title: Woman charged with murder of man believed to be her partner, police say
item.description: A woman has been charged with murder after a man was reported unconscious in South Australia's mid-north on Friday and could not be revived.

item.title: Homicide Squad investigating 'suspicious' death of 84yo woman in Sydney suburb of Melonba
item.description: The Homicide Squad is investigating the circumstances surrounding the death of an 84-year-old woman, who was found in her bedroom about midday Saturday.

item.title: Trump authorises deployment of 300 National Guard troops to Chicago
item.description: US President Donald Trump has deployed 300 Illinois National Guard troops to Chicago after Governor JB Pritzker refused to do so.

item.title: Who is Sanae Takaichi, set to be Japan's first female PM?
item.description: Sanae Takaichi has won Japan's Liberal Democratic Party's leadership contest and is likely to become the country's first female PM. Here's what we know about her.

item.title: US Treasury unveils draft design for $1 Trump coin to mark 250th independence celebrations
item.description: In 2020, the US Congress passed a law that allows the Treasury Secretary to mint $1 coins in 2026 "with designs emblematic of the US semi-quincentennial".

item.title: Lithuania's Vilnius Airport reopens after unknown balloon sightings halt flights over the weekend
item.description: In total, around 30 flights and nearly 6,000 passengers were impacted by the closures.

item.title: Mark Latham's ex-girlfriend Nathalie Matthews charged with sharing intimate images
item.description: Nathalie Matthews, 38, was arrested after arriving into Sydney on a flight from Dubai this morning.

item.title: NRL grand final live: Brisbane Broncos beat Melbourne Storm, Adam Reynolds injured, Brisbane ends Roosters' NRLW streak in decider
item.description: The Brisbane Broncos beat the Melbourne Storm 26-22 in the NRL grand final despite both halves to injury in the second half. Follow live.

item.title: More than 100 guns seized in WA Police raids targeting 'sovereign citizens'
item.description: More than 100 firearms are seized in a WA Police operation targeting 'sovereign citizens' in the wake of the fatal shooting of two Victorian officers.

item.title: The advice Ray Martin lives by and the line journalists 'shouldn't cross'
item.description: After six decades as a journalist, Ray Martin says he has learnt the secret to a long and satisfying career.

item.title: Mega-team of heavy horses sets world record at Good Old Days Festival
item.description: Scores of heavy horses have been harnessed together at a heritage festival in southern New South Wales in what organisers say is a world record.

item.title: European Space Agency launches second space antenna in New Norcia, north of Perth
item.description: A second deep space antenna opened in a tiny monastic town in Western Australia could help unlock the secrets of the universe.

item.title: Rescuers recover more bodies of teenage victims after school collapse in Indonesia
item.description: The number of students confirmed dead after the collapse of an Islamic boarding school building in Indonesia has risen to 37, from 16 a day earlier, the country's disaster mitigation agency says.

item.title: Mass civil wedding in Paraguay's capital sees more than 600 couples say 'I do' in unison
item.description: The event was part of a government campaign aiming to make civil weddings more accessible across the country.

item.title: Tigers end AFLW drought in shock 11-point win over Crows as Blues and Eagles enjoy victories
item.description: Richmond's dismal losing streak is over, with midfielder Monique Conti playing a starring role in a shock win over competition heavyweights Adelaide.

item.title: Around 20 campers were relocated on Saturday due to the threat of a large out-of-control bushfire in the island's north.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Authorities will investigate campfire that sparked major Moreton Island blaze
item.description: A "careless" campfire lit during a fire ban sparked a rapidly moving blaze that has now burnt hundreds of hectares on Moreton Island, according to authorities.

item.title: Liberty Bell Bay smelter receives first shipment of ore since flagging financial woes
item.description: A $20 million loan from the Tasmanian government to keep smelter Liberty Bell Bay afloat after it flagged financial woes earlier this year has led to the first shipment of ore being delivered.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Zion Williamson stars as NBA side New Orleans Pelicans defeat Phoenix 127-92
item.description: The New Orleans Pelicans have outclassed the South East Melbourne Phoenix 127-92 to conclude their two-game Australian tour.

item.title: Mele Haufanga's NRLW premiership-winning try now an unsolvable mystery
item.description: Brisbane and the Roosters played one of the greatest games in NRLW history, but the controversial winning try to Mele Haufanga shapes as a football mystery that might never be solved.

item.title: Dozens dead after landslides, flash floods in Nepal and India's Darjeeling region
item.description: Heavy rains have triggered landslides and flash floods, blocking roads, washing away bridges and killing dozens in Nepal and West Bengal, authorities said.

item.title: F1 live SIngapore Grand Prix: Oscar Piastri starts third behind George Russell and Max Verstappen
item.description: McLaren can win the constructors' championship in Singapore, but the dominance they enjoyed earlier this season has faded, with Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris battling for the drivers' title. Follow live.

item.title: Man arrested after shots fired in Sydney's Croydon Park, launching major police operation
item.description: A man has been arrested after a number of shots were fired in the inner-west Sydney suburb of Croydon Park and four people were injured.

item.title: Reece Walsh wins Clive Churchill Medal to ice Broncos's NRL premiership success
item.description: In one of the greatest individual performances in grand final history, Brisbane Broncos star Reece Walsh was judged player of the match after inspiring his side to their victory over the Melbourne Storm.

item.title: NRL grand final quick hits: Reece Walsh creates magic after avoiding sin bin as Broncos survive Hunt, Reynolds injuries to win premiership
item.description: Reece Walsh put in an NRL grand final performance for the ages after an early stroke of luck as the Brisbane Broncos survived the loss of both Ben Hunt and Adam Reynolds to end a 19-year premiership drought.

item.title: How the internet reacted to Brisbane Broncos winning the NRL grand final
item.description: The internet could barely believe what was happening as Brisbane, fuelled by Reece Walsh's brilliance, came from behind to win the NRL grand final.
